markdown:
Skip to main content

###### Menu

____ Show/hide collapsed content

SkilledTradesBC supports community groups and organizations, teachers and tradespeople to deliver short, informative, hands-on focused workshops and presentations through the What’s a Trade? Workshop grant. This grant offers access to ready-to-use trades kits and additional information and resources for groups to engage in learning about skilled trades careers. 

Check out our What’s a Trade? Workshop Guide and Application below to learn more about the funding and how to apply! 

  * [What's a Trade? Workshop Guide](/media/1789/download)

  * [What's a Trade? Workshop Application](/media/1788/download)

  * [What's a Trade? Completion Report](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/sites/default/files/2023-03/What%27s%20a%20Trade%20Completion%20Report.pdf)

  * [Media Consent Form](https://analytics.clickdimensions.com/cn/adufq/consent-form)




**What's a Trade grant funding for the 2024/2025 fiscal year has been allocated. You may still apply for the grant and we will notify you should any additional funding become available.**

**We appreciate your patience and understanding, and encourage you to explore partnerships with other organizations that may support your initiatives. Thank you for your continued commitment to promoting skilled trades.**

Our partnered resources for project ideas or kits: 

Construction Foundation of BC Skills Ready Project Portal: [Projects - Skills Ready](https://projects.skillsready.ca/)   
The Learnary Tinker Kits: [Tinker Kits: by The Learnary](https://the-learnary.square.site/tinker-kits-by-the-learnary)
